page.title: 03Housing in the area.
page.content: In the village of Aberlour, there is a mixture of old and new houses. There is also a mixture of private housing and council housing. There are two new housing schemes, at Sellar Place and Taylor Court, both named after local people. The houses are mainly one or two storeys high, the older ones being built of stone. The houses in the village itself are quite close together but the main street is wide so that cars can park on both sides without blocking the traffic. Outside the village, the houses are spaced out along the roads leading in different directions. In the High Street, some houses are above or next door to shops.
